singles.vanbancauhoi: A man is calling his sister. Where are they going to meet?
A woman is talking about her vacation. What is the relationship between the speaker and Lisa?
Anna is calling her brother Max. What does Anna do later in the afternoon?
A man is talking about his trip. What did he enjoy last year?
Doctor’s office is calling to change the appointment. When is the new appointment?
Vincent is calling James. Why does Vincent call James?
A man calls the teleshop. What is the teleshop number?
Two people are talking about meeting for dinner. What time does Ahmed meet Rose?
Max is calling his friend. How much can Max pay for the computer?
A man is talking to the shopping assistant. What color top does he buy?
Alice is calling her friend. What did she lose?
A man is talking about the city concert. How will the concert end?
Jana is talking to her friend. What does Jana’s sister look like?

multiples.title: Đề 12 - Listening part 14
multiples.des: Listen to the opinions of 4 people talking about their purposes of using the Internet, and answer the questions.

lstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich: Person A: I spend quite a bit of my free time online, mostly because I love watching movies. The Internet makes it so easy to find a wide variety of films, from the latest releases to old classics. I can stream them directly on my laptop or TV without needing to go out and buy DVDs or rent movies. I just pick a film and relax. It’s the best way to unwind after a long day, and I can watch whatever I want, whenever I want.

Person B: The main reason I use the Internet is to stay in touch with my friends. It’s great because I can talk to people who live far away without any issues. Whether it's through social media, video calls, or messaging apps, the Internet allows me to communicate easily and quickly. My best friend loves using the Internet for studying online courses, but that’s not really for me. I prefer just chatting and staying connected through messages and calls.

Person C: For me, the Internet is an essential tool for completing my school assignments. I use it to research information, find articles, and access educational websites that help me understand my subjects better. It’s so convenient because I can find everything I need online without having to spend hours in the library. I also use it to download notes and submit my homework. It has really made studying more efficient, and I can work from anywhere, whether it’s at home or on the go.

Person D: Whenever I need to plan a trip or get somewhere, I always use the Internet to find transportation details. I can check train schedules, bus routes, and even look up flights. It helps me figure out the best way to travel, and I can even buy tickets online. I like how I can get real-time updates about delays or changes. It makes traveling much easier and saves me the hassle of standing in line at stations or airports.

multiples.title: Đề 12 - Listening part 15
multiples.des: Listen to two people discussing singers and music. Read the opinions below and decide whose opinion matches the statements, the man, the woman, or both the man and the woman. You can listen to the discussion twice.

lstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Singer can be good models for the young _
Taste in music is a highly personal thing _
Music can be used to manipulate people’s feelings. _
lstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Woman: You know, I really believe that singers can be good role models for young people. Their influence can inspire kids to pursue their dreams and express themselves. Just think about how many young artists start singing because they look up to someone famous.


Man: I’m not so sure about that. While some singers may have positive messages, others don’t always set the best example. Sometimes their lifestyles can be quite the opposite of what we’d want kids to emulate.


Woman: Fair point, but I think many young fans look up to their favorite artists and adopt their values. Artists like Taylor Swift or Ed Sheeran often promote kindness and hard work.


Man: I get that. But when it comes to taste in music, it’s such a highly personal thing. What resonates with one person might not resonate with another. I mean, I might love rock while my friend prefers classical!


Woman: Absolutely! Everyone has their own preferences, and that’s what makes music so interesting. It’s like a reflection of our individual personalities.


Man: Exactly! And speaking of music, I believe it’s a universal language that connects people from different cultures. You can go anywhere in the world and find someone who enjoys music.


Woman: I don’t fully agree with that. While music can connect people, its meanings can vary greatly between cultures. A song that makes one group happy might not even be understood by another.


Man: True, but one thing we can both agree on is that music can be used to manipulate people’s feelings, whether in advertising or emotional moments in movies.


Woman: Definitely! It’s amazing how a song can evoke such strong emotions in us. Just think about those movie soundtracks that give you chills or make you cry. Music has that incredible power.


Man: Right? It’s fascinating how a simple melody can tap into our emotions so deeply.

multiples.title: Đề 12 - Listening part 16
multiples.des: Listen to a TV announcer talking about a writer's new novel. Choose the correct answers.

lstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: What does the announcer say about the new novel?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: It is different from his earlier works
It is less famous than his earlier works

lstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: What does  the announcer say the writer should do in the future?
lstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Announcer: Good evening, everyone! Today, we’re excited to talk about the latest novel by popular author James Parker. He is known for his softer, romantic stories like Whispers of the Heart, which have touched the hearts of many readers. However, his new novel, Shadow in the Night, is quite different.

In Shadow in the Night, Parker explores a thrilling world of suspense and mystery. He moves away from his gentle love stories to deliver an exciting plot filled with unexpected twists. The tension in this book is much higher, showing that he can write in different styles.

While many readers are excited about this new direction, I believe it’s important for Parker to pay attention to the critics’ advice as he works on his next book. Their feedback can help him improve his writing and find the right balance between romance and thrill that fans appreciate. Stay tuned for more updates on this talented author!

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: The writer should continue to write this genre
The writer should go back to his original genre
He should listen to critics before writing his next work

multiples.title: Đề 12 - Listening part  17
multiples.des: A radio MC talks about a famous musician’s life. Choose the correct answers.

lstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: What has the musician decided regarding his singing career?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: He will make a comeback after a long break
He will retire from singing professionally
He will inform fans about new albums

lstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: What could the musician have achieved with his recent albums?
lstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Radio MC: Good afternoon, everyone! Today, we’re diving into the life of a beloved musician who has decided to retire from singing professionally. Unlike in the past, where he would inform his fans and then make a comeback, this time he’s serious about stepping away for good.

His talent has always shone through, and many believe he could have achieved even greater success with his recent albums. However, the long break he took between projects made it difficult for him to regain his previous momentum. Fans were excited to see him return, but the gap left some wondering if he could still capture the magic he once had.

As he prepares for this new chapter in his life, we can only reflect on the incredible music he’s given us over the years. He leaves behind a rich legacy that will inspire future generations of artists. Stay tuned for more updates on this iconic musician!

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: He could have been more successful
He could have inspired future generations
He could have gotten a bigger fan base.

readings.title: Đề 12 - Reading p2
readings.des:
The sentences below are from some directions. Put the sentences in the right order. 


Instruction for end of term report

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: 0. Following these instructions to complete the end of your term report

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: Before writing, spend a week looking at websites for the information you need
Remember to save the links to those websites and include them in your report
You should also include a list of any books you use for reference
When you have finished writing, read through to correct spelling mistakes
After making corrections, send your report by email to the college secretary

readings.title: Đề 12 - Reading p3
readings.des:
The sentences below are from some directions. Put the sentences in the right order. 

Instruction for attending conference.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: 0. When you arrive at the conference building, head towards the entrance.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: When you have a conference pass, go to the lift on the right.
Take the lift to the third floor, go to the main desk.
Show your pass from the conference to a member of staff at the desk.
He or she will give you a seat number for the talk at the main hall.
Once you enter the hall, someone will find the seat for you

readings.title: Đề 12 - Reading p4
readings.des:
Read the four opinions the on their holiday. Then, answer the questions.

Person A: 

I visited there last summer and I also really enjoy watching the street performances that the city organizes. It adds a vibrant and entertaining element to my travel experience, and I feel immersed in the local atmosphere. I planned to buy some souvenirs but at the end of the trip, I ran out of money, which I deeply regret..

 

Person B: 

When I visit a new place, I tend to spend a bit more on shopping because I believe memorable experiences are worth it. I enjoy treating myself to delicious food, whether trying local specialties or dining at popular restaurants, as it allows me to explore the local cuisine. Buying souvenirs also reminds me of the unique experiences and culture I encountered during my journey.

 

Person C: 

Personally, I thought the city's public transport was really good. It was easy to use, efficient, and well-organized. It made getting around and exploring different areas of the city a breeze. It also relieved my worry about walking too much during my trip. I realized the importance of taking care of my feet and not pushing myself too hard. This way, I could enjoy my trip without feeling uncomfortable or tired.

 

Person D: 

I don't generally go to big cities, asI prefer staying in one area of the city to fully experience the local culture and attractions. I enjoy destinations that feature natural resorts, where I can relax and appreciate the beauty of nature. This way, I can escape the fast pace of city life and truly connect with my surroundings.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Who usually enjoys buying things when they travel?  - _
Who enjoyed the street theatre that the city puts on? - _
Who paid a lot for their meal? - _
Who spent their holiday in only 1 part of the city? - _
Who enjoyed the natural resort there? - _
Who thought the public transport system was good? - _
Who was concerned about too much walking causing a problem? - _

readings.title: Đề 12 - Reading p5
readings.des:
Read the passage quickly. Choose a heading for each numbered paragraph (1-7) from the drop-down box.

The early Australians

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
1. _
The history of early Australians stretches back much further than previously believed, with evidence suggesting human presence on the Australian continent dating back approximately 65,000 years. This timeline challenges traditional views held by historians regarding the first human settlers in Australia. Carbon analysis of archaeological sites has provided different results, leading to alternative hypotheses about the early inhabitants of the land Down Under. The findings shed new light on the ancient origins and rich cultural heritage of the Indigenous people who have inhabited the continent for millennia.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: Technology helps uncover the sea’s secrets
The determination of the explorer in ages
An alternative history to the settlement

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
2. _
Recent discoveries have revealed that the settlement of Australia was not a singular event. In addition to the early settlers, scientists have uncovered traces of two other human groups that migrated to the continent. The presence of multiple groups suggests a complex history of human migration and interaction. However, reaching the isolated continent would have posed significant challenges for ancient humans, as they would have needed to traverse vast stretches of open sea, a feat seemingly impossible with the technology available to them at the time.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: Technology helps uncover the sea’s secrets
The determination of the explorer in ages

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
3. _
The aid of advanced equipment and techniques has allowed scientists to identify a series of small islands closely connected, forming a continuous pathway leading to Australia. Remote sensing technology has helped researchers identify and map small islands and potential migration routes. Geographic Information Systems (GIS) have integrated various data sets, to discover about the past migration corridors.This discovery provides insight into the probable routes taken by ancient migrants as they ventured across the vast expanse of the sea, providing a deeper understanding of the complex migration patterns that shaped the early history of the continent.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: An alternative history to the settlement
Technology helps uncover the sea’s secrets
The determination of the explorer in ages

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
4. _
The migration patterns of early Australians reveal a gradual journey to the continent. Archaeological evidence points to the likelihood of different tribes arriving in Australia through a series of island-hopping journeys. Each island served as a resting point and a source of food, allowing them to continue their voyage. This gradual movement indicates an adaptive and resourceful approach taken by these ancient tribes, who navigated the challenges of the terrain to ultimately settle in Australia.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: An alternative history to the settlement
Technology helps uncover the sea’s secrets
The determination of the explorer in ages

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
5. _
Scientists can only speculate about the exact number of individuals required to undertake such a migration, which could have ranged from a small group to several thousand people. The uncertainty stems from various factors, including the limitations of available archaeological evidence and the complexities of ancient human migration. The lack of exact statistics makes it challenging to determine the scale and composition of these early human journeys accurately. However, ongoing research and technological advancements may offer more insights in the future.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: An alternative history to the settlement
Technology helps uncover the sea’s secrets
The determination of the explorer in ages

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
6. _
Some skeptics argue that ancient humans didn’t have enough the intellectual capacity, knowledge, and skills needed to undertake such journeys. They question whether early humans possessed the navigational and maritime expertise to traverse vast stretches of ocean. Critics contend that without advanced tools or navigational aids, navigating through open seas would have been beyond the capabilities of ancient civilizations. However, it is crucial to acknowledge that human ingenuity and adaptability have proven remarkable throughout history, enabling our ancestors to overcome various challenges and achieve extraordinary feats.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: An alternative history to the settlement
Technology helps uncover the sea’s secrets
The determination of the explorer in ages

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
7. _
History has demonstrated the unwavering determination and resilience of human explorers in the past. From deep-sea expeditions in ancient times to modern space travel, humans have showcased their resolve to explore and conquer the unknown. The same determination might have driven the early Australians to embark on perilous journeys across treacherous waters. While the challenges they faced were undoubtedly immense, the spirit of human curiosity and the desire to discover new lands and opportunities likely motivated these ancient explorers, leaving a remarkable legacy in the annals of history.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: An alternative history to the settlement
Technology helps uncover the sea’s secrets
The determination of the explorer in ages

readings.title: Đề 12 - Reading p1
readings.des: Choose one word from the list for each gap. The first one is done for you

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: The water is _ and i can see many fish
The _ is always out and it’s very hot
I’m lucky to have such an _ holiday
After _ so hard, i needed some time off
I hope to _ a letter from you soon.

speakings.title: Đề 12 - Speaking 1
speakings.des:
In this part, I am going to ask you three short questions about yourself and your interests. You will have 30 seconds to reply to each question.

Begin speaking when you hear this sound.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Please tell me about your family.
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Version 1: As for this question, my family has 4 people, which are my parents, my older sister and me. We also adopted a cat, whose name is Tom. My sister doesn't live with us but we keep in touch every day through our phones. That's all I want to share and thank you for listening. 

Version 2: My family is small. I live with my parents and my younger sister. My mom works at a hospital, and my dad is a teacher. My sister is still in school. We often spend time together on weekends, like going to the park or watching movies. I love my family very much.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Please tell me about the last time you visited friends.
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Version 1: Two years ago, on the second day of Tet holiday, I had dinner at my friend’s house, who is my best friend. I had a hot pot party and had a good time with her family.  It was a memorable night. That's all I want to share and thank you for listening

Version 2: The last time I visited my friends was last weekend. We met at one of my friend’s houses. We played video games together and had some snacks. It was a lot of fun, and I stayed there for a few hours before going home.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Please tell me about your first school.
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Version 1: When I recall my first school, I always feel nostalgic. I had a lot of unforgettable memories with my friends. I was tutored by some of the best teachers at that time and I still feel grateful  that I once studied here. That's all I want to share and thank you for listening.


Version 2: My first school was very small. It had a playground and many classrooms. The teachers were nice, and I made many friends there. I still remember the games we played during breaks. It was a fun place to learn and grow up.

speakings.title: Đề 12 - Speaking 2
speakings.des:
In this part, I'm going to ask you to describe a picture. Then I will ask you two questions about it. You will have 45 seconds for each response.

Begin speaking when you hear this sound.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Describe this picture.
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
In the picture, I can see 2 men on the street.

In the background, I cannot see anything because it is so blurry. 

In the front, there are 2 men wearing grey vests. 

It is clear that 1 man is reading the newspapers and the other one is surfing the Internet. 

I guess they are feeling attentive. 

To be honest, this picture is so beautiful that it might have been taken by a professional.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: How do you usually find out about the news?
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich: Let me tell you about how I usually find out about the news. I often use my phone to read the news everyday. It is a wonderful way for me to broaden my social knowledge and make friends who have the same hobby. Besides, I read newspapers because it is time-saving and convenient.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Why is it important to read about the news everyday?
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich: It is important to read about the news everyday for several reasons. First, it is a good way to broaden people’s social knowledge and gain more experience. Second, reading about the news allows people to refresh my mind and reduce stress after a long day at work. For me, I often read news everyday to update about life.

speakings.title: Đề 12 - Speaking 3
speakings.des:
In this part, I'm going to ask you to compare two pictures, and I will then ask you two questions about them. You will have 45 seconds for each response.

Begin speaking when you hear this sound.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Describe 2 pictures.
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich: Both pictures show me entertaining activities.  In the first picture, I can see a family sitting on a white car. They are taking selfies with their phones and looking very happy, as I can see the smiles on their faces. In the second picture, there is a man in a café. He is sitting by himself and taking notes, which shows that he is focused and attentive. I think everyone in these pictures is having a good time. I prefer the first picture because I love travelling with my family.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Do you prefer recording memories by picture or by words? Why?
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich: I prefer recording memories by picture because they show real moments. A photo can capture a smile or a beautiful place very quickly. When I look at a picture, I remember how I felt at that time. Words are nice, but they can be harder to remember.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Why do people like taking photos with their mobile phones?
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich: People like taking photos with their mobile phones because of several reasons. First, it is cheap and convenient. Everyone has a phone, so it’s simple to take a picture anytime. Second,  They can share their photos with friends and family on social media, which makes them feel connected.

speakings.title: Đề 12 - Speaking 4
speakings.des:
In this part, I'm going to show you a picture and ask you three questions. You will have one minute to think about your answers before you start speaking. You will have two minutes to answer all three questions.

Begin speaking when you hear this sound. Look at the photograph.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
Tell me about a time you were with someone older or younger than you.

How do you feel in the situation?

How do you think different generations can learn from each other?
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Now, I am going to answer the 3 questions, which are: 

  • Tell me about a time you were with someone older or younger than you.
  • How do you feel in this situation?
  • How do you think different generations can learn from each other?

Regarding the first question, let me tell you about a time that I was with someone older or younger than me and it was when my parents took me to Danang City.

Well, Da Nang is famous for its beaches, and for example one of them is My Khe, which is one of the most wonderful beaches in the world, so every year, there are many tourists going to the area to see the beauty of the beach. Therefore, going to this city was extremely expensive for me at that time.

It was when I was a second- year student at university. At that time, I really wished for a trip to Danang city. So after exams, my parents gave me a gift by taking me to Danang city so that I can relax and reduce stress after a long day at studying. My dad is 30 years older than me because he is now 50 years olds.  My mom is now 45 years olds.  

Turning to the second question, at that time, I felt very delighted and excited because I could gain more experience after the trip .  

As for the final question, I agree that Different generations can learn a lot from each other. For example, older people can share their experiences and teach younger ones important life lessons. Younger people can teach older ones about new technology and trends. 

Thank you for listening.

writings.title: Đề 12 - Writing part 1
writings.des: You want to join a music club. You have 5 messages from a member of the club. Write short answers (1–5 words) to each message. Recommended time: 3 minutes.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: What is the weather like today?
What are you wearing today?
What is your favorite kind of music?
Which sport is the most popular in your country?
What do you like doing with your friend?

writings.title: Đề 12 - Writing part 2
writings.des: You are a new member of the music club. Fill in the form. Write in sentences. Use 20–30 words. Recommended time: 7 minutes.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Tell us about the last time you went to a museum.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: Last weekend, I visited the National Museum in Hanoi with my family. To be honest, I enjoyed the visit because it helped me relax and relieve stress after days of studying.

writings.title: Đề 12 - Writing part 3
writings.des: You are communicating with other members of the club in the chat room. Reply to their questions. Write in sentences. Use 30–40 words per answer. Recommended time: 10 minutes.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: I went to the museum at school. How was the time when you visited the museum when you were a child?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: I did not visit museums as a child, but as I imagined, it must have been a great way to explore history, science, or art. Nowadays, the exhibits likely spark curiosity and open up new perspectives about the world, making learning an enjoyable experience.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: I want to take my children to a museum but I don’t know which, the History Museum or Sports Museum. Can you give me advice?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: If I were you, I would choose the Sports Museum because it is definitely more engaging than the History Museum. This is especially true since it provides an opportunity for them to learn about teamwork and communication skills through inspiring stories.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Some museums have added technologies like computer screens in their museum and this attracts more visitors. Why?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: There are several reasons why some museums have added technologies like computer screens in their museum and this attracts more visitors. This is because screens can make information more engaging. For example, people can see videos or pictures that make history come alive, rather than just reading texts.

writings.title: Đề 12 - Writing part 4
writings.des:
You are a member of the travel club. You have received this email from the club.

Dear members,

The museums are free of charge but next year museums will require tickets and this might decrease visitors. What do you think? Make suggestions and explain.

Bests,
Club Manager.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Write an email to your friend. Write about your feelings and what you think the club should do about the situation. Write about 50 words. Recommended time: 10 minutes.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi:
Hi Lucas,
How is it going? I hope you and your family are fine.
Have you received the email from our club about the charge on the museum visiting tickets next year?
I am very sad to hear that news.
I think I will write an email and send it to the government about selling tickets next year because it will reduce attendance
What do you think about this? Hope to hear from you soon
Yours,
Peter

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Write an email to the president of the club. Write about your feelings and what you think the club should do about the situation. Write 120–150 words. Recommended time: 20 minutes.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi:
Dear Club Manager,
My name is Peter. I have been a member of our club for 3 months. I am writing in response to your latest email.
I am writing in response to your latest email.
According to the news, our club is planning to implement changes, such as charging admission fees to museums next year. 
To be honest, I am quite worried to hear that news. I believe that most of our members in the club share my sentiments about this change. It is high time we made some radical changes to address this problem. 
I would love to share my ideas. I think we should introduce a discounted membership program or offer free days once a month to encourage people to continue visiting. Besides, it is also advisable that we create engaging, themed events to attract new visitors. 
By implementing these strategies, we can enhance the visitor experience and ensure a steady stream of attendees. As a result, this approach could help mitigate the potential negative impact of the changes.
I hope my suggestions will be useful and I am looking forward to hearing from you soon.
Best regards,  
Peter
